study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize gold-silver core-shell nanoparticles using Garcinia mangostana peel extract and evaluate their efficacy as a targeted drug delivery system for colorectal cancer treatment.
results_summary: PCA-loaded Au-AgNPs showed significantly higher inhibitory action (IC50 = 10.78 μg/ml) against HCT116 colon cancer cells compared to free PCA (IC50 = 148.09 μg/ml) and Au-AgNPs alone (IC50 = 24.36 μg/ml), with up to 80% inhibition at 15.63 μg/ml and better selectivity for cancer cells over normal cells.
population_specificity: HCT116 colon cancer cells and CCD112 colon normal cells (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: IC50 values: PCA-loaded Au-AgNPs (10.78 μg/ml), free PCA (148.09 μg/ml), Au-AgNPs alone (24.36 μg/ml).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the potential of Garcinia phytochemicals as a molecular therapy for breast cancer by reviewing existing literature.
results_summary: The review found that Garcinia phytochemicals exhibit anticancer properties, including apoptosis induction, proliferation inhibition, and metastasis suppression. The study highlighted multiple bioactive compounds in Garcinia with potential therapeutic effects against breast cancer.
population_specificity: Breast cancer (in vitro or in vivo studies, not specified in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antidiabetic and antihyperlipidemic effects of Garcinia cambogia fruit rind extract in a diabetic rat model.
results_summary: Garcinia cambogia extract did not show antidiabetic activity but significantly reduced total cholesterol levels and body weight in diabetic rats.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin-nicotinamide induced diabetic Wistar rats (n=6 per group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Garcinia mangostana pericarp extract and α-mangostin on restoring hepatic cytochrome P450 enzyme expression in ulcerative colitis-induced mice.
results_summary: The study found that Garcinia mangostana pericarp extract and α-mangostin restored the suppressed expression of multiple CYP enzymes and their activities in DSS-induced ulcerative colitis mice, comparable to the control and the anti-inflammatory drug sulfasalazine.
population_specificity: Male ICR mice with dextran sulfate sodium-induced ulcerative colitis.
effective_dosage: GM pericarp extract (40, 200, and 1000 mg/kg/day), α-mangostin (30 mg/kg/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diuretic and antiurolithic effects of methanolic extract (MEGHL), dichloromethane (DCM), and ethyl acetate (EtA) fractions from Garcinia humilis leaves.
results_summary: MEGHL, DCM, and EtA promoted diuresis in rats, with MEGHL increasing urinary Na+, K+, and Cl- excretion at 30 mg/kg, while DCM and EtA increased K+ and Cl- excretion without affecting Na+. All preparations reduced calcium oxalate crystal formation in vitro.
population_specificity: Female rats
effective_dosage: MEGHL (3, 10, 30 mg/kg), DCM (1, 3, 10 mg/kg), EtA (1, 3, 10 mg/kg)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review trends in the production and extraction optimization of Garcinia cambogia bioactive components, focusing on hydroxy citric acid (HCA), and to evaluate analytical approaches for quality control and pharmacokinetics.
results_summary: The study highlights the importance of extraction optimization for product quality and discusses analytical methods for assessing Garcinia cambogia and its nutraceuticals, including HCA content. It also presents novel approaches for detecting metabolites in biological fluids to evaluate pharmacokinetics and efficacy.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and evaluate the neuroprotective effects of new polyoxygenated xanthones derived from Garcinia cowa latex on glutamate-mediated hippocampal neuronal HT22 cell death.
results_summary: Six new xanthones were isolated, with compound 1 showing the most potent neuroprotective effect (>80% cell viability at 2.9-115 μM). Compound 1 reduced Ca2+ influx, inhibited reactive oxygen species generation, and mitigated glutamate-induced MAPK phosphorylation, Bax, and AIF translocation in HT22 cells.
population_specificity: Hippocampal neuronal HT22 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Garcinia morella fruit extract (GME) could protect against dopaminergic neurodegeneration and reverse motor behavioral abnormalities in a mouse model of Parkinson's disease.
results_summary: GME administration prevented dopaminergic neuron loss, restored mitochondrial complex II activity, reduced inflammatory markers (GFAP and nNOS), and reversed parkinsonian behavioral abnormalities in the MPTP mouse model. It also recovered striatal dopamine and its metabolites.
population_specificity: MPTP-induced Parkinson's disease mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether and how neobractatin (NBT), a compound from Garcinia bracteata, induces GSDME-mediated pyroptosis and apoptosis in esophageal cancer cells.
results_summary: NBT reduced esophageal cancer cell viability primarily through GSDME-mediated pyroptosis, activated caspase-3, and induced ROS accumulation, leading to antitumor effects in vitro and in vivo. Knocking down GSDME shifted cell death from pyroptosis to apoptosis.
population_specificity: Esophageal cancer cells (KYSE150) and xenograft models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antimicrobial activity of α-mangostin derived from Garcinia mangostana against various microbes and compare its effectiveness to commercially available antibiotics.
results_summary: The study found that α-mangostin reduced microbial counts effectively, showing comparable efficacy to antibiotics and inhibitory effects on antibiotic-resistant microbes. The meta-analysis indicated no significant difference in effectiveness between α-mangostin and antibiotics.
population_specificity: Microbes (bacterial or fungal strains tested in vitro or in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the multitarget inhibitory potential of xanthones from Garcinia mangostana against digestive enzymes (α-amylase, α-glucosidase, and pancreatic lipase) relevant to type 2 diabetes and obesity.
results_summary: The study identified five bioactive xanthones and synthesized six derivatives, with compounds 2, 4, 5, 6, and 9 showing multitarget activity. Compound 6 exhibited notable inhibitory effects (IC50 values: 33.3 µM on α-amylase, 69.2 µM on α-glucosidase, and 164.4 µM on pancreatic lipase). Molecular docking revealed competitive, mixed, and non-competitive inhibition mechanisms depending on the enzyme.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Garcinia nigrolineata bark resin extract could reverse cognitive deficits and oxidative stress induced by chronic mild stress in mice, and assess its inhibitory effects on β-amyloid aggregation and monoamine oxidase enzymes.
results_summary: The study found that Garcinia nigrolineata bark resin extract reversed stress-induced learning and memory deficits in mice by mitigating oxidative stress in the brain. Additionally, isolated prenylated xanthones from the extract showed inhibitory activity against β-amyloid aggregation and monoamine oxidase enzymes.
population_specificity: Mice subjected to unpredictable chronic mild stress (UCMS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties of Garcinia mangostana with other herbs and a standard antibiotic in a rabbit model of S. aureus-induced dermatitis.
results_summary: Garcinia mangostana demonstrated significant antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties, effectively reducing bacterial infection, lipid peroxidation, and inflammatory cytokine expression. It was identified as the most effective herbal extract for treating dermatitis among the tested herbs.
population_specificity: New Zealand white rabbits with artificially induced S. aureus-infected wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether subfractions of G. kola extract could prevent motor disorders and improve metabolic parameters in a diabetic encephalopathy mouse model.
results_summary: The ethyl acetate fraction and its fifth eluate (F5) preserved fine motor skills, improved body weight, and stabilized blood glucose levels in diabetic mice. GC-MS analysis identified β-lactam molecules as the most abundant compounds in F5, suggesting their role in the observed antidiabetic effects.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin (STZ)-induced diabetic mice.
study_duration: Until marked motor signs developed in diabetic controls (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the leishmanicidal potential of Garcinia cowa phytochemicals through in-silico molecular docking against key Leishmania donovani enzymes.
results_summary: Garcinia cowa methanolic extract showed significant anti-promastigote activity (IC50 21.4 µg/ml). In-silico analysis revealed that its phytochemicals, particularly norcowanin, had lower binding energies and higher affinities than the synthetic drug Pentamidine against target enzymes.
population_specificity: In-silico study (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and discuss the activity and usefulness of Garcinia in treating metabolic syndrome, obesity, and related conditions.
results_summary: Garcinia demonstrated multiple beneficial effects, including reducing body fat mass, blood sugar levels, body weight, total cholesterol, and triglycerides, mediated by inhibiting enzymes like fatty acid synthase, α-amylase, and α-glucosidase. It was proposed as a potential herbal treatment for metabolic syndrome.
population_specificity: Individuals with metabolic syndrome, obesity, or overweight (not further specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the topical administration of a combination of Sargassum duplicatum and Garcinia mangostana extracts improves diabetic open wound healing in mice.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of S. duplicatum and G. mangostana extracts enhanced wound healing by increasing re-epithelialization, fibroblasts, fibrocytes, and collagen synthesis while reducing neutrophils and macrophages. The treatment improved the open wound healing process in diabetic mice.
population_specificity: Adult male BALB/c strain mice (Mus musculus), 3-4 months old, 30-40 g, streptozotocin-induced diabetic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify potential neuraminidase inhibitors from Garcinia atroviridis L. (GA) and evaluate their activity against viral neuraminidase.
results_summary: The study identified garcinia acid and naringenin as bioactive compounds, with garcinia acid showing the highest neuraminidase inhibitory activity (IC50 of 17.34-17.53 µg/mL against Clostridium perfringens-NA and 56.71-57.85 µg/mL against H1N1-NA). Molecular docking suggested garcinia acid interacts with key arginine residues in viral neuraminidase, indicating potential as an inhibitor.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Not specified (enzyme inhibition study used µg/mL or µM concentrations)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of Garcinia mangostana pericarp extracts, alone and in combination with other herbal extracts, for treating localized canine demodicosis.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of YN oil and WC (Rhinacanthus nasutus leaf) showed the most improvement in dermatological lesions, but the specific efficacy of Garcinia mangostana pericarp extracts alone or in combination was not clearly highlighted beyond its inclusion in the treatment groups.
population_specificity: Mixed-breed dogs with localized demodicosis.
study_duration: 1 month of treatment, with monitoring for 60 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the phytochemistry, pharmacological activities, and ethnomedicinal potentials of Garcinia kola.
results_summary: The study identified multiple bioactive compounds in Garcinia kola and demonstrated its broad pharmacological effects, including anti-inflammatory, antimalarial, hepatoprotective, and antioxidant activities. However, clinical trials are needed to confirm safe dosages and efficacy.
population_specificity: Not specified (in-vivo and in-vitro studies only)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer efficacy of Garcinia mangostana extract (GME) in various human cancer cell lines and its potential synergistic effects with doxorubicin.
results_summary: GME reduced cell viability and induced apoptosis in multiple cancer cell lines, inhibited cell migration by suppressing MMP2 activity, and altered oxidative stress markers. It also showed synergistic efficacy when combined with doxorubicin.
population_specificity: Human prostate cancer (PC3), melanoma (B16F10), breast cancer (MCF7), and glioblastoma (U87) cell lines.
study_duration: 24 hours for some assays (e.g., ROS, MDA, GSH, SOD); exact duration for other assays not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticoccidial effects and safety of Garcinia kola extracts in broiler chickens infected with Eimeria tenella.
results_summary: Garcinia kola crude methanol extract (CME) significantly improved weight gain, reduced oocyst counts, enhanced hematological parameters, and decreased histopathological lesions in infected chickens, demonstrating dose-dependent efficacy.
population_specificity: Broiler chickens experimentally infected with Eimeria tenella.
effective_dosage: 200, 400, and 600 mg/kg of CME administered orally for five consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether alpha-mangostin (α-man) could suppress cardiomyocyte hypertrophy and fibrosis in vitro.
results_summary: α-man significantly suppressed hypertrophic responses in cardiomyocytes by inhibiting Akt phosphorylation and reduced fibrotic responses in cardiac fibroblasts by inhibiting NOX4-generated ROS. These findings suggest α-man may help prevent cardiac hypertrophy and fibrosis.
population_specificity: Neonatal rat cardiomyocytes and cardiac fibroblasts

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether gamma-mangostin (gMG) from Garcinia mangostana could suppress GSK3β-associated signaling in colorectal cancer (CRC) cells and overcome cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF)-induced drug resistance and cancer stem-like cell generation.
results_summary: The study found that gMG treatment suppressed GSK3β-associated signaling pathways, increased miR-26b-5p levels, reduced tumor growth in a xenograft model, and overcame CAF-induced 5-fluorouracil resistance in CRC cells.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer cells (in vitro and in vivo mouse xenograft models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to isolate xanthones from Garcinia forbesii and evaluate their antioxidant, antidiabetic, and antiplasmodial activities in vitro and in silico.
results_summary: Four xanthones (Compounds 2-5) showed strong antioxidant activity, with Compounds 2 and 5 being more active against α-glucosidase and Compound 4 against α-amylase. Compounds 2 and 3 exhibited inhibitory activity on Plasmodium falciparum, and molecular docking confirmed these findings.
population_specificity: In vitro and in silico models (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to isolate compounds from Garcinia mangostana flowers and test their anti-Acanthamoeba and anti-adhesion activity against Acanthamoeba triangularis.
results_summary: The extract and compounds, particularly α-mangostin, showed significant anti-Acanthamoeba activity (MIC 0.25-1 mg/mL) and effectively reduced adhesion of A. triangularis trophozoites on contact lenses and polystyrene plates. α-Mangostin was non-toxic to Vero cells at concentrations below 39 μM.
population_specificity: In vitro study (Acanthamoeba triangularis and Vero cells).
effective_dosage: 0.25-1 mg/mL for anti-Acanthamoeba activity; 0.5 × MIC (0.25 mg/mL) for anti-adhesion.
study_duration: 24 hours for SEM and adhesion tests.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of Garcinia cowa fruit extract (GCE) on ethanol-induced gastric lesions in rats and explore its potential mechanisms.
results_summary: GCE demonstrated dose-dependent inhibition of ulcer index, restored gastric wall mucus and NP-SH content, reduced microvascular permeability, and improved oxidative enzyme levels, confirming its protective effect against gastric ulcers.
population_specificity: Rats (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Garcinia kola seed extract and garcinoic acid could reduce SARS-CoV-2 spike protein S1-induced inflammatory cytokine production and lung cell damage.
results_summary: Garcinia kola extract and garcinoic acid significantly reduced pro-inflammatory cytokine secretion (TNFα, IL-6, IL-1β, IL-8) and inhibited NF-κB signaling in spike protein-stimulated PBMCs, while also reducing damage to lung epithelial cells.
population_specificity: Human peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) and A549 lung epithelial cells (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Garcinia kola extract (6.25, 12.5, 25 μg/ml); garcinoic acid (1.25, 2.5, 5 μM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential anticancer effects of compounds (depsidone and benzophenone) extracted from the bark of Garcinia porrecta, focusing on their activity against breast cancer cells.
results_summary: Benzophenone showed moderate anticancer activity (IC50 of 119.3 µg/mL) against MCF-7 cells, though less potent than doxorubicin, and exhibited strong binding affinity for ER-α. Depsidone had high binding affinity for HER-2 but its IC50 could not be determined.
population_specificity: In vitro (MCF-7 breast cancer cells) and in silico (molecular docking analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Garcinia kola seeds could mitigate cognitive and motor function decline in gamma-irradiated rats as a model for acute radiation syndrome.
results_summary: Garcinia kola significantly prevented body weight loss and mitigated cognitive and motor function decline in irradiated rats, with effects comparable to or better than vitamin C. The irradiated control group showed severe cognitive and motor impairments, which were alleviated by Garcinia kola treatment.
population_specificity: Wistar rats exposed to gamma radiation.
effective_dosage: 100 mg/kg of ethyl acetate fraction of methanolic extract of Garcinia kola seeds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether mangosteen peel infusion could mitigate liver and kidney damage caused by hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) in rats.
results_summary: Mangosteen peel infusion, particularly at 2%, reduced reactive oxygen species (ROS) levels, normalized creatinine levels, and improved liver and kidney histopathology after H2O2 induction.
population_specificity: Female Wistar rats
study_duration: 1 month of treatment after 2 months of H2O2 induction

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify novel Eg5 inhibitors from Garcinia species, specifically evaluating the inhibitory effects of kolaflavanone (KLF) on mitotic kinesin Eg5.
results_summary: KLF inhibited both basal and microtubule-activated ATPase activities of Eg5 through an allosteric mechanism and suppressed microtubule gliding in vitro. Molecular docking revealed KLF binds to the α2/α3/L5 pocket of Eg5, similar to known inhibitors.
population_specificity: In vitro and in silico analyses (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antimalarial activities of Garcinia parvifolia extracts and fractions against Plasmodium falciparum.
results_summary: The dichloromethane stem extract (BP12-S-D) showed the highest inhibition of P. falciparum growth with an IC50 of 6.61 μg/mL. Further fractionation yielded fraction-1 (F1), which exhibited the strongest antimalarial activity (IC50 6.00 μg/mL), likely due to flavonoid and xanthone compounds.
population_specificity: Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to uncover the molecular mechanisms by which Garcinia cambogia regulates adipogenesis and autophagy to combat obesity.
results_summary: Garcinia cambogia suppressed adipogenic factors (CEBPB, Cebpa, Pparg) and autophagic flux while increasing KLF3 expression, leading to reduced adipose tissue mass and adipocyte size in an obese animal model.
population_specificity: Obese animal model (high-fat diet-induced obesity)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-proliferative effect of essential oil from Garcinia atroviridis leaves (EO-L) against PANC-1 human pancreatic cancer cells, including its potential synergistic effects with 2-deoxy-d-glucose (2-DG).
results_summary: EO-L showed anti-proliferative effects with an IC50 of 78 µg/mL and moderate synergism with 2-DG, inducing mitochondrial membrane depolarization, cell growth arrest, and apoptosis. Molecular analysis revealed upregulation of P53, HIF1α, and HK2, and downregulation of CYP3A5.
population_specificity: PANC-1 human pancreatic cancer cell line (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the anti-inflammatory activity of Garcinia extract and its interaction with aquaporins (AQPs) in LPS-induced acute systemic inflammation in Wistar rats.
results_summary: Garcinia extract significantly reduced LPS-induced inflammation by lowering mRNA expression of AQPs, inhibiting NO, prostaglandin, cytokine, and chemokine production, and decreasing transcript levels of inos and cox-2. Molecular docking studies showed interactions between Garcinia's phytoconstituents (garcinol and hydroxycitric acid) and AQPs.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar rats (n=6)
effective_dosage: Oral administration twice for 7 days (exact dosage not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Garcinia mangostana pericarp (GMP) extract on cerebral inflammation in Wistar rats with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) by measuring markers like NF-κB, IL-6, TNF-α, and SOD.
results_summary: GMP extract significantly reduced hippocampal NF-κB, IL-6, and TNF-α levels while increasing antioxidant SOD activity in diabetic rats, suggesting it prevents cerebral inflammation in T2DM. The effects were dose-dependent, with 200 g/kg BW/day showing notable efficacy.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats (8-10 weeks old) with induced T2DM.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prolonged diuretic and renoprotective effects of TDP, a compound derived from Garcinia achachairu, in normotensive and spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results_summary: TDP significantly increased urinary volume and electrolyte excretion in both rat groups over 7 days, improved antioxidative capacity, and alleviated renal morphological changes in hypertensive rats without altering plasma electrolyte levels or urinary pH.
population_specificity: Normotensive and spontaneously hypertensive rats.
effective_dosage: 0.1 mg/kg TDP, administered orally once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the HIV-1-RNase H inhibitory activity of garcinol and isogarcinol from Garcinia indica and assess their potential as cost-effective treatments for HIV.
results_summary: Garcinol demonstrated higher HIV-1-RNase H inhibition than the known inhibitor RDS1759 and retained full potency against a drug-resistant HIV-1 reverse transcriptase form. Isogarcinol was less active, highlighting the importance of garcinol's enolizable β-diketone moiety for anti-RNase H activity, supported by docking calculations.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the molecular interactions between compounds from Garcinia kola (catechin, garcinal, garcinoic acid, d-tocotrienol) and the PDE-5 receptor linked to erectile dysfunction (ED).
results_summary: The study found that garcinoic acid showed the best binding affinity (-10.0 kcal/mol) with the PDE-5 receptor, suggesting potential as an ED treatment alternative. Other compounds also exhibited inhibitory effects, though less pronounced.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico molecular docking study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antiviral activity of α-Mangostin against Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) infection and its potential as a prophylactic/therapeutic agent.
results_summary: α-Mangostin at 8 µM completely inhibited CHIKV infectivity in vitro under cotreatment conditions and significantly reduced virus replication in mice, suggesting it interacts with multiple CHIKV target proteins.
population_specificity: Vero E6 cells and CHIKV-infected mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the cytotoxicity and apoptosis-inducing properties of compounds isolated from Garcinia subelliptica leaves, particularly their potential for treating acute leukemia.
results_summary: The study identified seven compounds from Garcinia subelliptica leaves, with garcinielliptone G (5) showing significant growth inhibition by inducing apoptosis in human leukemia cells (THP-1 and Jurkat). Apoptosis occurred via both caspase-3 activation and caspase-independent pathways, suggesting its potential as a leukemia treatment candidate.
population_specificity: Human acute monocytic leukemia (THP-1) and T lymphocyte (Jurkat) cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to isolate and quantify major compounds from Garcinia gardneriana seed extracts and evaluate their phytotoxic activities.
results_summary: The study found that the crude extract had no phytotoxic effect on Sorghum bicolor, but isolated compounds fukugetin and 7-epiclusianone showed moderate activity, while guttiferone-A exhibited strong herbicide activity, surpassing glyphosate at lower concentrations. Computational studies suggested guttiferone-A interacts with transferase enzymes, indicating a potential mechanism of action.
population_specificity: Sorghum bicolor plants (phytotoxic assay).
effective_dosage: Concentrations of 0.46 to 1.13 mg mL-1 for isolated compounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Garcinia mangostana fruit peel extract as a green stabilizer for synthesizing Fe3O4 nanoparticles for magnetic hyperthermia and colon cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that Fe3O4 NPs stabilized with Garcinia mangostana extract exhibited desirable physicochemical properties, improved colloidal stability, and selective cytotoxicity against HCT116 colon cancer cells compared to normal colon cells, with the 10 wt.% extract formulation showing the lowest IC50 value in cancer cells.
population_specificity: In vitro colon cancer (HCT116) and normal colon (CCD112) cell lines.
effective_dosage: 1, 2, 5, and 10 wt.% of Garcinia mangostana extract in Fe3O4 NPs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the potential of Garcinia mangostana pericarp extract and α-mangostin against Acanthamoeba triangularis, as well as their synergistic effects with chlorhexidine in treating Acanthamoeba infection.
results_summary: The study found that Garcinia mangostana pericarp extract and α-mangostin exhibited inhibitory effects on A. triangularis trophozoites and cysts, with synergistic effects when combined with chlorhexidine, reducing the required MIC. SEM results showed cell membrane damage and irregular cell shapes in treated Acanthamoeba.
population_specificity: Acanthamoeba triangularis (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 0.25 and 0.5 mg/mL for trophozoites; 4 and 1 mg/mL for cysts

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the reported beneficial properties of Garcinia pedunculata and identify gaps in understanding its molecular mechanisms, pharmacological actions, and chemical composition.
results_summary: The study highlights Garcinia pedunculata's traditional medicinal uses, including antioxidant, antibacterial, antifungal, and various protective properties, but notes a lack of detailed understanding of its mechanisms and chemical composition.
population_specificity: Not specified (traditional use in Assam, India, and general research contexts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the protective effect of γ-mangostin, a component of mangosteen, against oxidative damage and apoptosis in nerve cells induced by excessive glutamate.
results_summary: γ-Mangostin showed strong neuroprotective effects by reducing reactive oxygen species, inhibiting apoptosis pathways, and preventing glutamate-induced damage in HT22 cells, outperforming N-acetyl cysteine.
population_specificity: Mouse hippocampal HT22 cells (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: 5 mM glutamate was used to induce damage; γ-mangostin dosage not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the phytochemical composition, safety profiles, and antioxidant and antiobesity effects of methanolic extracts of Garcinia atroviridis (MeGa) in obese female rats.
results_summary: MeGa was found to be nontoxic with an oral LD50 of 2000 mg/kg. Treatment with MeGa resulted in lower weight gain, improved lipid profiles, and altered metabolic pathways related to lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis in obese rats.
population_specificity: Obese female rats
effective_dosage: Not specified (lethal dose LD50 was 2000 mg/kg)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antioxidant, glucose-lowering, and anti-diabetic potential of Garcinia linii extracts, including their effects on insulin regulation and enzyme inhibition.
results_summary: The study found that Garcinia linii extracts exhibited significant antioxidant activity, inhibited α-amylase and α-glucosidase, and improved glucose regulation in vivo, suggesting potential therapeutic value for diabetes treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo models used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of adjunctive mangosteen pericarp extract compared to placebo in treating schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between the mangosteen and placebo groups in symptom improvement, functioning, or quality of life measures over 24 or 28 weeks. Despite preclinical promise, mangosteen pericarp extract did not demonstrate efficacy as an adjunctive treatment for schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder.
population_specificity: People diagnosed with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder (DSM-5 criteria) across two sites in Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify novel compounds targeting DNA repair pathways using biosensor cells and tested an extract from Garcinia cowa Roxb. ex Choisy for its effects on DNA damage and repair.
results_summary: The crude extract from Garcinia cowa induced DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs), as indicated by increased γH2AX, and the damaged DNA appeared to be repaired primarily through the non-homologous end-joining (NHEJ) pathway, evidenced by elevated 53BP1 focus formation.
population_specificity: Biosensor cells engineered to monitor DNA repair pathways (not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the hepatotoxicity risks associated with dietary supplements, including Garcinia cambogia, and highlight the importance of causality assessment and regulatory awareness.
results_summary: The abstract mentions Garcinia cambogia as a notable example of dietary supplements linked to liver injury, but no specific results about its efficacy or safety are detailed. The focus is on the broader issue of supplement-related hepatotoxicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on dietary supplement users)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticonvulsant activity of dihydroxanthone derivatives, particularly oliganthin H, isolated from Garcinia oligantha, and explore their potential mechanisms of action.
results_summary: Oliganthin H significantly reduced PTZ-induced convulsions in zebrafish, suppressed seizure-related behaviors, and restored aberrant gene expressions linked to GABA-glutamate pathways. In silico analysis suggested stable binding to the GABAA receptor as a potential mechanism.
population_specificity: Zebrafish larvae

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of Garcinia cambogia supplement on obesity indices (weight, BMI, PFA, and WC) in human randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Garcinia cambogia significantly reduced weight (-1.34 kg), BMI (-0.99 kg/m²), PFA, and WC compared to placebo. The results were statistically significant but modest in effect size.
population_specificity: 530 subjects in eight randomized controlled trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the physical performance and muscle strength-enhancing effects of a proprietary composition (GMCT) containing Garcinia mangostana and Cinnamomum tamala extracts in both preclinical and human trials.
results_summary: GMCT significantly improved swimming endurance, grip strength in mice, and muscle strength, size, and lean mass in resistance-trained humans, without affecting hormone levels or causing adverse effects. Clinical parameters remained normal, indicating safety.
population_specificity: Resistance-trained young adult males (mean age 26.32 ± 4.39 years).
effective_dosage: 300 mg/kg in mice; human dosage not specified in abstract.
study_duration: 21 days in mice, 42 days in humans.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and tolerability of Meratrim (containing Garcinia mangostana) for weight management in healthy overweight subjects.
results_summary: The study found statistically significant reductions in body weight, BMI, waist and hip size, as well as improvements in serum LDL, triglycerides, and total cholesterol in the Meratrim group compared to placebo, with no reported adverse events.
population_specificity: Healthy overweight subjects with a mean BMI of 28.3 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the safety of Garcinia cambogia (GC) extract, particularly its association with acute liver failure, and review existing clinical evidence on its hepatic toxicity.
results_summary: The study reported four cases of acute liver failure in women taking GC extract for weight loss and highlighted documented risks of herb-induced liver injury and unpredictable herb-drug interactions associated with GC-containing supplements.
population_specificity: Women using GC extract for weight loss.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate Garcinia Cambogia's effectiveness, mechanism of action, recommended dosage, side effects, and contraindications as an adjunct treatment for obesity.
results_summary: Some studies showed positive effects on weight loss, appetite reduction, body fat percentage, triglycerides, cholesterol, and glucose levels, while others found no effect. The ideal dosage remains unclear, but adverse effects were minimal, with potential protective effects against ethanol-induced hepatotoxicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (general obesity population inferred).

study_goal: To compare the effectiveness of a simplified 5-step hand hygiene program versus a conventional 7-step program among students with intellectual disabilities.
results_summary: The simplified 5-step program significantly improved handwashing technique and cleanliness scores compared to the conventional 7-step program at 6 months post-intervention. Both groups showed a reduction in sick leave days by 10 months.
population_specificity: Chinese students with intellectual disabilities

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the determinants of child handwashing and key motivational drivers of children's behavior in a humanitarian setting to aid future intervention design.
results_summary: The study found that access to soap and water was high, but handwashing was influenced by familial roles, environmental factors, hygiene promotion exposure, and social norms. Children were most motivated by play and nurture, suggesting motive-based interventions could enhance handwashing practices.
population_specificity: Children aged 7-12 years, caregivers, and hygiene promoters in an internally displaced persons camp in Northern Iraq.

study_goal: To assess the effects of a school-based WASH intervention on handwashing behavior among primary students in NW Tanzania.
results_summary: The intervention improved students' capability and motivation for handwashing, particularly after toilet use, and enhanced handwashing knowledge and skills. Handwashing opportunity improved, though water and soap availability was inconsistent.
population_specificity: Primary school students (aged 7-15) and teachers (aged 23-52) in NW Tanzania.
study_duration: Data collected between April and October 2018 (exact intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of handwashing education on awareness, attitude, and handwashing skills of third-grade elementary school students in Tehran.
results_summary: The study found that handwashing education significantly improved awareness, attitude, and handwashing performance in the intervention group compared to the control group, with statistically significant differences (P < 0.05). Practical training, educational posters, and videos were effective in enhancing these outcomes.
population_specificity: Third-grade elementary school students (mean age 9 years) in Tehran, Iran.
